additionalProperties.description: _key_ is the name of the plugin

name.description: name of the parameter as used in the API

position.description: Position of the parameter in the output.

ConfigParamEmail.description: **email** is an email address consisting of loca part and domain name.

_id.description: An eas file id from fylr.

ConfigParamFile.description: **file** is an eas file managed by fylr.

ConfigParamForm.description: **form** is one row of nested parameters.

plugin_type.description: For some JSON, we support predefined schema.

ConfigParamJson.description: The value of this type is and abritrary JSON object.

default.description: Location is a name of a configured location

ConfigParamLocationSelect.description: This presents a location select to the user.

ConfigParamSecret.description: **secret** is string which will be stored encrypted in the database, if `fylr.encryptionKey` is set.

options.description: The list of options available for choice.

ConfigParamSelect.description: **select** is a choice select for one out of a list of options

choices.description: The list of options available for choice.

ConfigParamStringList.description: **string-list** is a list of choices presented to the user.

choices.description: The list of options available for choice.

ConfigParamStringListSort.description: **string-list-sort** is a list of sortable choices presented to the user.

fields.description: Items of this array are of schema ConfigParam

default.description: Tagfilter is a map of sets of ids, as used in the fylr API.

ConfigParamTagfilterSelect.description: This presents a tagfilter select to the user.

ConfigParamTextLocaMultiline.description: **text-l10n-multinline** is like `text-l10n` but displayed in multiline form.

ConfigParamTextMultiline.description: **text-multiline** is like `text` but displayed in a mutliline form.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when this license was created.

domains.description: Must match fylr.externalURL, allows simple wildcard "*".

edition.description: Edition of the license, such as "workgroup", "department", or "organization".

holder.description: Name of the holder of the license.

issuer.description: Name of the issuer of the license.

key.description: UUID of license file, e.g., for blacklisting.

type.description: Type of license, such as "subscription" or "buy".

from.description: Valid from this date, if empty already valid.

to.description: Valid to this date, if empty license does not expire.

enabled.description: Set to **true** if this tag is available?

is_default.description:
Set to **true** if the tag is set by default when creating new objects.
This is a frontend only flag.

sticky.description: If set this tag cannot be removed by Pools which maintain their own tag lists.

type.description:
A tag group of type **checkbox** can set multiple tags of that group. A tag group
of type **choice** can only set one tag of that group.

items.description: Each item describes a config setting.

group.description: The **group** sets the tab this config variable is in.

name.description: The unique name of this config

require_system_right.description: System right which this config requires, e.g. "system.root" if it requires root rights.

unauthenticated_visible.description: If true, this config is visible to unauthenticated sessions (access token with no user).

additionalProperties.description: _key_ is the name of the plugin

_duplicates.description: If set, this attribute can hold an array of duplicates.

certainty.description: The certainty of the duplicate detection in percent. A value of 1.0 means 100%. Currently **fylr** can only detect exact same files (as per file hash).

_column_id.description: The column API id of the column holding the duplicate file.

_system_object_id.description: The `_system_object_id` of the object using the duplicate file.

_id.description: The `_id` is **created** _when_ a file is uploaded into the fylr server.

_linked_objects.description: When a file is uploaded and linked to a collection via [`/api/eas`](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/api/endpoints/api-eas), the attribute contains a list of objects created based on the upload settings of that collection.

_version.description: The `_version` of the object created or updated. An upload may update an existing object if a version or series detection added a file to an existing nested or an existing file array.

_mapped_metadata.description: A rendered version of the object data retrived and mapped from this file's metadata. It can be used to create objects based on a pre-configured metadata mapping.

best_date.description: Best date is a compiled UTC timestamp from the technical metadata. **fylr** uses the first set date from `technical_metadata.date_time_original`, `technical_metadata.create_date`, `date_uploaded`.

children.description: For originals which use a pageable format, like `PDF`, this attribute contains the pages available underneath the original. The format is string and the value is using the file's `_id` and the page number (starting at `0`) separated by `/`.

class.description: The compiled class of the file. The classes are set by the recipe. Standard recipes of fylr include `image`, `audio`, `office`, `video`. The fylr frontend uses the class to pick the general player to view the file. A class `unknown` is assigned if no matching recipe was found but the upload accepts _unknown types_.

class_extension.description: A compiled concatenation of `class`, `version`, joined by `.`. This is used for aggregations of files

class_version_status.description: A compiled concatenation of `class`, `version` and `status`, joined by `.`. This is used for aggregations of file status.

compiled.description: A compiled version of the metadata for this file. For images this looks like this: `	JPG, 1920 x 1285 px, 569.5 kB`.

compiled_props.description: A fielded version of `compiled`. Frontends can use this to beatify the compiled output of the metadata.

dimensions.description: The rendered dimensions for this file. This may include a unit. For page sizes European paper sizes like A4 will be recognised.

duration.description: Runtime of the audio or video file.

extension.description: The upper cased version of the `extension`.

pages.description: The number of pages followed by a ` p.`. Frontends may localize this manually.

date_uploaded.description: The UTC timestamp when this file was uploaded.

eas_parent_id.description: The `eas_parent_id` is the id of the file this file is derived from. When using **/api/produce**, the newly produced files will get the parent id set to the file they are produced from.

extension.description: The compiled extension of the file. This is matched by parsing available recipes at the time of the metadata generation. Extensions are matched by longer length first. So for a file `flower.webdvd.zip` the extension matched would be `.webdvd.zip` and not `.zip` if there is an available recipe.

frontend_prefs.description: Set only in relation to an object. This map can contain custom attributes and values.

hash.description: The `hash` is a non unique identifier of the file. For remote files, it is the [**md5sum**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Md5sum) of the URL, for local files it is the [**SHA-256**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SHA-2) of the binary file data. It is calculated together with the metadata for the file and a copy of `technical_metadata.sha256_hash`. The `hash` is used for duplicate detection.

is_original.description: Set to true if the file is an original. It is false if the file is a generated or uploaded rendition. Produced files are registered as originals underneath the original they are produced from.

last_status_at.description: The UTC timestamp when the last status change was last written to the database.

reference.description: The `reference` of the file to look up.

groupnames.description: Sorted list of metadata group names found in `groups`.

group.description: The group name of the attribute

value.description: The value can be any type

name.description: Custom name of the file. This is set in the relation to the object. When retrieving the file via [`/api/eas`](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/api/endpoints/api-eas).

original_filename.description: The filename as set by `original_filepath` minus the path.

original_filename_basename.description: The filename as set by `original_filepath` minus the path and the detected `extension`.

original_filepath.description: Filename of the file as set during the upload. On Windows, this can contain drive letters and backslashes.

pages_allowed.description: Indicates that the file has pages.

preferred.description: This may be set if the file is in the context of an object. If set, preferred indicates that this version is the preferred one in a list of other versions.

reference.description: If set, this reference string is a unique string identifying the file. If the reference contains a `sha244:<hash>` or `sha256:<hash>`, the provided hash can be checked against the file's checksum using an action triggerable in **/inspect/files**. Other parts of the reference can be added but must be separated by `:`.

status.description: The status of the file. Known states are: `pending`, `processing`, `sync`, `done`, `failed`. Files and renditions can be accessed in status `sync` and `done`. Only files in state `done` can be exported.

technical_metadata.description: An object to describe technical aspects of the file. See [Technical Metadata](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/system-data-types/file#technical_metadata) for details.

upload_user.description: The user who uploaded this file into the system. If the upload happens via Hotfolder, the uploader is the owner of the upload collection.

user.description: This will show a short representation of [user](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/system-data-types/user).

additionalProperties.description: The file version specification can be found [here](https://docs.fylr.io/for-developers/system-data-types/file#file_version).

versions.description: `versions` contains a map with renditions for the file. Depending on the users permissions, not all versions might be accessible.

frontend_prefs.description:
Frontend preferences can be any JSON Map with data used by applications. The
conventions here is that each application can use its on key on the top level
of this Map. Only this key may be modified by the application, foreign keys
must be kept unchanged.

id.description:
The **_id** is a used to uniquely identify an object. It is automatically
assigned by the server for new objects.

It is possible to manually set the **_id**, the internal sequence will be
adopted accordingly.

lang.description: Texts used to for language aware contexts.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when this license was created.

domains.description: Must match fylr.externalURL, allows simple wildcard "*".

edition.description: Edition of the license, such as "workgroup", "department", or "organization".

holder.description: Name of the holder of the license.

issuer.description: Name of the issuer of the license.

key.description: UUID of license file, e.g., for blacklisting.

type.description: Type of license, such as "subscription" or "buy".

from.description: Valid from this date, if empty already valid.

to.description: Valid to this date, if empty license does not expire.

enabled.description: Set to **true** if this tag is available?

is_default.description:
Set to **true** if the tag is set by default when creating new objects.
This is a frontend only flag.

sticky.description: If set this tag cannot be removed by Pools which maintain their own tag lists.

type.description:
A tag group of type **checkbox** can set multiple tags of that group. A tag group
of type **choice** can only set one tag of that group.

format.description: The format of the file: `landscape`, `portrait` or `square`.

_generated_displayname.description: The generated displayname of the user. This uses `login` and `email`.

_id.description: The id of the user. It is automatically assigned.

version.description:
The **_version** needs to be set to **1** for new objects and set to an
incremented number on each object update. This is used to ensure that two
clients do not overwrite data of the same object.

info.description: This API documentation is work in progress and not yet complete.
info.title: FYLR API

/config.description:
Administrators can define base configuration using this API. fylr has a basic
set of configuration items which are in the core system, such as the name of
the instance, administrator's main address, language definitions and so on.

Frontends are required to implement a generic form editor for base
configuration items. The list of items can be retrieved using the
[config/list](list/) API.

This list is not stable and can be changed without API change in any new
version of fylr. Plugins can extend the list of configuration items. So,
depending on the list of loaded plugins in fylr, the list has a various number
of items.

apikey.description: The string will be encrypted in the server if fylr.encryptionKey is set in fylr.yml. In API responses, if a value is set, the response will always be *** or ***** to indicate that an encrypted value is stored. ***** mean that the value is actually stored encrypted, whereas *** means the value is stored as plain text.

tagfilter.description: Tag filter definition with any, all and not

List of tag ids which must not match

frontend_prefs.description: An arbitrary object which is stored alongside with the relation. Make sure your application uses its own top level key in that object and that you do not overwrite existing data (other top level keys).

bindpassword.description: The string will be encrypted in the server if fylr.encryptionKey is set in fylr.yml. In API responses, if a value is set, the response will always be *** or ***** to indicate that an encrypted value is stored. ***** mean that the value is actually stored encrypted, whereas *** means the value is stored as plain text.

200.description: The response contains the base configuration values.

get.description:
The list is a dynamic compilation of available config varibles. It includes
fixed config variables of FYLR's base config as well as variables provided
by plugins.

/eas/fileId.description: The **eas** endpoint is used to upload and download files. Files are an essential part of a **fylr** system. Files and objects are separate entities. In order to use a file, it must be linked to an object by its `ID`. Files cannot be updated, in case of an update a new file `ID` is issued and linked to the updated object.

200.description: The response contains the base configuration values.

parameters.description: If set, the call is only checking if the current user is allowed to update the file information.
parameters.name: permission_check_only

match.description: If the version matches, the custom parameters overwrite the recipe's parameters. It is mandatory to have at least one parameter set, otherwise this overwrite will be ignored.

filename.description: The new filename of the file. It is stored as `original_filepath`.

reference.description: The reference string for the file. Note that the reference is unique across all files in the storage.

oneOf.description: This object is returned for a successful permission check.

post.summary: Change information about a file. You need the `RIGHT_ASSET_UPLOAD` right to update the file information.

get.description:
This settings endpoint is unprotected and delivers brief information about
the running fylr instance. It can also be used to check the current status
of the running fylr.

build_commit.description: The GIT commit hash set at compile time.

build_commit_time.description: The UTC timestamp of the GIT commit hash the fylr was built with.

config_name.description: The internal name of the instace, as set in the base configuration.

external_url.description: The url this fylr is reachable under. This is configured in the fylr yaml.

index_names.description:
Index names as used in the Elatic indexing system. There is
two indexes for reading (BaseRead & ObjectRead) and two for
writing. New writing indexes are created when a reindex is
started. Once that reindex has finished, the read index is
deleted and the read index name becomes the write index name.
If these names are identical, the index is up to date.

instance.description: The name of the instance as set in the yaml config file.

name.description:
A UID generated when the database is created. The name gets
re-created when **/api/purge** is used. This name is used as
prefix for Elastic index names.

startup_time.description: UTC time of when the server was started.

version.description:
The version of the server. Changed with every release, follows
semantic versioning rules.

version_release_date.description: If known, the release date of this **version**. <unreleased> if not yet released.

200.description: Brief information about the running fylr.

x-fylr-status.description:
Current status of the fylr system:
  * `startup`: Set during startup of fylr. Should rarely be seen.
  * `reindex`: System is re-indexing. This happens after a `reindex_block` is used during a schema commit.
    This state is also reached briefly after a regular `reindex`.
  * `busy`: If too many db connections are open, the system response with `busy`.
  * `ready`: In this state fylr is ready to answer requests.

get.description: This endpoint returns all available taggroups and tags.
